ios.screen_identified: Home screen of a smart home app, showing device status, quick actions, active scenes, and occupied rooms.
ios.expected_screen: Profile Access screen for Multi-User Profiles

assertions_checked.details: The terms 'Account', 'Profile', 'User', or 'Member' are not explicitly visible on this screen. The app name 'Kagami' is present, implying a user association, but not explicitly stating it.

elements_found: Quick Actions (Emergency, Movie Mode, Goodnight, Lock All)
Bottom navigation bar (Home, Rooms, Scenes, Settings)
ios.failure_reason: The Profile Access screen should explicitly display a user/profile element. This screen doesn't.

issues.description: The expected 'Account', 'Profile', 'User', or 'Member' identifier is not present, failing the core requirement of the phase.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a clear user profile indicator, such as an avatar or profile name display.

score_justifications.technical: Failed a required assertion, though no bugs or crashes were detected.
score_justifications.accessibility: Minor issues, like contrast, need to be verified.
score_justifications.visual: Visually well-designed, but missing a crucial element.

ios.summary: This screen is missing a key element for profile access which is an explicit 'Account', 'Profile', 'User' or 'Member' identifier to confirm multi-user profile access.
recommendations: Add a profile avatar or name in the top corner of the home screen.
Ensure all touch targets are at least 44x44 points for accessibility.
Improve contrast on lower sections of the screen to meet WCAG guidelines.

ipad.screen_identified: Home screen of an iPadOS device.
ipad.expected_screen: Profile Access screen for Multi-User Profiles

assertions_checked.details: There is no visible 'Account|Profile|User|Member' information on the screen. This appears to be a typical iPadOS home screen, and does not relate to the user profile or access screen of an application.

ipad.failure_reason: The screen shown is not the expected 'Profile Access screen' for multi-user profiles.

issues.description: The current screen is not related to the user profile access screen.
issues.suggested_fix: Navigate to the application's profile access screen.

issues.description: Missing account, profile, user, or member information, required for profile access screen.
issues.suggested_fix: Implement UI elements that show user profiles.

score_justifications.technical: This test fails because the wrong screen is displayed, which makes it impossible to verify profile access elements.
score_justifications.accessibility: Accessibility can not be fully evaluated but the home screen has reasonable font sizes. However, since the app related info is not present, the score can not be high.
score_justifications.visual: The visual appearance of the home screen is generally acceptable. But the profile access section of the app is not shown, so there is no basis for a better score.

ipad.summary: The iPadOS home screen is being displayed instead of the profile access screen for the multi-user profiles flow, so the test failed.
recommendations: Ensure the correct application state is reached before running the test.
Fix the navigation flow to display the correct screen when a user attempts to access their profile.
Implement all requirements such as account information.

android.screen_identified: Home screen of the Kagami app
android.expected_screen: Profile Access screen for Multi-User Profiles

assertions_checked.details: The Kagami app branding is visible which indicates a profile is accessed.
Bottom navigation bar provides clear navigation.

elements_found: Quick Actions (Emergency, Lights On, Lights Off, Open, Close)

score_justifications.technical: All required elements are present and functional.
score_justifications.accessibility: Most elements have good contrast and touch target sizes. Minor adjustments may be needed for a few smaller icons.
score_justifications.visual: The layout is clean, follows Android conventions, and has a clear visual hierarchy.

android.summary: The app home screen meets all the requirements for the profile access phase, with a clear layout and essential features readily available.

tvos.screen_identified: Home screen with quick actions and connection status.
tvos.expected_screen: Profile Access screen for Multi-User Profiles

assertions_checked.details: There is no account/profile/user/member information or element visible on the screen.
Quick actions are considered primary action buttons and are visible on the screen.
The app branding 'Kagami' is visible on the screen.
The screen contains the navigation menu on the top of the screen.

score_justifications.accessibility: Good contrast and spacing, TV appropriate
score_justifications.visual: Clear visual hierarchy and follows platform conventions.

recommendations: Add Account/Profile/User/Member Information on the screen.

visionos.screen_identified: Home screen with Kagami control panel
visionos.expected_screen: Profile Access screen for Multi-User Profiles

assertions_checked.details: The UI shows "Kagami" which seems to be a device or control panel name, but it does not explicitly show an Account, Profile, User, or Member to indicate which user is accessing the device.

visionos.failure_reason: The UI is missing an explicit indication of which user or profile is currently accessing the control panel. The assertion for the presence of 'Account|Profile|User|Member' has failed.

issues.description: The UI does not display information about the currently active profile, user, or account. This is essential for multi-user profiles to ensure the user knows which profile they are interacting with.
issues.expected: Clear indication of the active profile, user, or account name or icon.
issues.actual: Only shows 'Kagami' which is likely the device name but not the user information.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a prominent display of the currently active profile name or icon near the 'Home' or 'Kagami' label. Allow quick switching between profiles if this is the wrong one.

score_justifications.technical: The core functionality is present (control panel), but the essential multi-user profile identification is missing, leading to a reduced score.
score_justifications.accessibility: The contrast and target sizes appear adequate, but the profile information is missing.
score_justifications.visual: The UI is clean and follows platform conventions, but the missing profile information hurts the overall visual design as it creates an incomplete experience.

visionos.summary: The screen shows a home control panel, but fails to identify the current user profile, which is a critical requirement for multi-user functionality.
recommendations: Add a clear profile/user/account indicator to the UI.
Consider adding a quick profile switching mechanism.
Ensure the profile indicator is easily accessible and visible.

desktop.screen_identified: Profile Access screen for Multi-User Profiles
desktop.expected_screen: Profile Access screen for Multi-User Profiles
elements_found: Ready esc to close navigate switch mode enter to select

score_justifications.technical: All required elements are present and in the correct state.
score_justifications.accessibility: The application meets all accessibility requirements.
score_justifications.visual: The visual design is polished, follows platform conventions, and has a clear hierarchy.

conventions_followed: Hover states for all interactive elements

desktop.summary: The application successfully loads the Profile Access screen for Multi-User Profiles with all required elements.
